section.name: Guiding Question #1
section.summary:
Instructional strategies to support success in the employment process

Now that you have an understanding of some common employment-related challenges that adults with LD face, let’s look at some ways educators can help them prepare for some of those challenges.

Guiding Question #1 asks:

What instructional strategies can instructors use to help adults with LD develop skills that will support success at each phase of the employment process?

Let’s begin by thinking about employer expectations for today’s workers.

Activity: Identify skills needed for success in the employment process

In 2006, a coalition of business groups conducted a study of 400 U.S. companies to find out what skills and knowledge employers expect workers to have in today’s economy. They reported their findings in a publication titled, “Are They Really Ready to Work? Employers’ Perspectives on the Basic Knowledge and Applied Skills of New Entrants to the 21st Century U.S. Workforce.”

In the quiz below, you will be asked to select the skills you think employers identified as essential during the 2006 study.
